data.title: My grandfather, Thomas Moses Beck (born Tamas Ripper on August, 21, 1929, in Budapest, Hungary) survived WWII, lived in more than a dozen...
data.meta_description:
178 likes, 26 comments - liviaar on June 19, 2024: "My grandfather, Thomas Moses Beck (born Tamas Ripper on August, 21, 1929, in Budapest, Hungary) survived WWII, lived in more than a dozen cities, spoke eight languages, married six times, and loved to sunbake, drink and dance. He died yesterday in Australia and, contrary to Jewish custom, asked to be cremated (and scattered on a nudist beach) because his life was ‚Äútoo big to fit into a box.‚Äù

Just hours before he died, he told me not to cry, and instead to listen to Frank Sinatra‚Äôs ‚ÄúMy Way‚Äù whenever I missed him. He will leave a huge hole in the lives of everyone that knew and loved him üíî‚òÄÔ∏è".
